page.title: 16The Primary School, Otford.
page.content: The Primary School is in the High Street and is a mixture of buildings from the 1870s to the 1970s which house at present about 240 children. Their ages range from rising fives to eleven plus and they are catered for in eight classes. The grounds are pleasant with a fine chestnut tree in the playground. A heated, enclosed swimming pool of 6m. by 15m. is very popular and swimming, with table-tennis are favourite out-of -school activities. The Headmaster has been at the school for ten years and most members of the staff are long-serving. A kitchen at the front of the building provides school lunches and the caretaker, school secretary, five lunch time supervisors , a Cook-Supervisor, and kitchen assistants make up the staff.
